response:
Silent pulls align
force in silence bends light now
Stars answer, we fall

Snow keeps moving on
momentum outlasts our touch
Friction writes the stop

acceleration
shoves a calm mass into speed
Time thins between ticks

Blue arrows glide west
velocity sets the chase
Worldlines braid at dusk

Where am I in space
position fixes the frame
Then motion can speak

Apples lean downward
gravity hums through old stone
Tides read the moon's call

Inertia sleeps
until a push wakes it hard
Mass keeps its own mind

prompt: Write a haiku about rigid body.
response:
Steel will not yield soon
rigid body holds its spin
Torques whisper, not break

A brief still moment
turns leverage into song
Hinges keep the tale

Spinning, the Earth sighs
rotation sketches circles
Day returns as light

Paths choose least action
Lagrangian counts the paths
Symmetry pays back

Hamiltonian
keeps energy on its rails
States trade phase for time

Motion in moonlight
maps straight lines in curved air thin
We chase, then we rest

Coins of the cosmos
conservation keeps them safe
Trade forms, not the sum

In labs, a constant
anchors our wild measures still
Numbers learn to breathe

Shoes kiss the dry road
friction steals the run of wheels
Heat blooms, then is gone

A bell swings slowly
oscillator counts our beats
Restoring force sings

Coiled spring waits, taut now
then snaps back to balance true
Hooke smiles in chalk dust

Dusty clock keeps time
pendulum draws calm arcs wide
Left, right, thoughts return

Night pad, hushed breath held
rocket drinks fire, climbs past clouds
Earth shrinks to a dot

Choose a frame to see
and laws look the same again
Shifting views agree

Carousel sky spins
non-inertial winds mislead
Fictitious forces

Dust on sundials
time carries our small clocks on
Moments fade to now

Planets never fall
orbit is their careful miss
Gravity holds dance

Hidden in quiet
energy changes its mask
Work becomes warm light
